reviews.review: this game is basically the first installment of the series, but BETTER. this game has very hard challenges, and a really fun second half. if you have played portal 1 and want a harder challenge, then 100% play this game.

I generally make it a point of not just gushing about how good a game is, but Portal 2 is just that damned good. 

Portal 2 is essentially a retelling of I Have No Mouth and I Must Scream, with GLADOS in place of AM and Chell in place of the protagonists. Like all great sequels, Portal 2 builds on the mechanics of Portal in an incredibly compelling way as opposed to simply rehashing them. Gameplay-wise, Portal 2 manages to replicate the puzzle mechanics of Portal with the addition of Gels to expand the puzzle mechanics. 

Now, Portal 2 is a fun game. I don't think that's negotiable by any standards almost. Where Portal 2 excels is with it's atmosphere and environmental storytelling. It does an amazing job of making it feel like you're inside the belly of this mad god, with everything from the air you breathe to the ground you stand on being subservient to them. 

Assuming you haven't already, play it. Well worth your money and time.

I'm not a fan of puzzle games or puzzles in games for that matter. I've had this game in my library for approximately 5 years ago and I took the chance to complete over the past year. In mid-late 2018, I completed Portal 2 CO-OP with a friend and loved it so much. Just the ability to work in a team and problem solve was great. In addition, the steam workshop brings so much life into this game with all the custom maps you can play and I doubt I've scratched the surface. Lastly, the single player component of this game, I have taken the last two weeks to finish the story. What a fantastic game. The level design in this game is great. I noticed on many occasions how Valve tries to give clues to the player on how to solve puzzles without giving them the answer. The story becomes more and more interesting as you progress. The soundtrack is eargasmic, the amount of times I just stopped to listen to the music and be absorbed in this world were countless. The environments are varied and beautiful. My only fault would be that some of the mid-late levels wore out on me and I didn't enjoy them as much. Overall though, this is an achievement in game making and level-design that's you need to [b]BUY AND PLAY NOW. Thank you Valve.

[h1] Un digno sucesor[/h1]

Muchas veces superar a un juego con tanta personalidad como Portal es difícil. O das más de lo mismo o cambias totalmente ofreciendo algo diferente. 

Pues Portal 2 ha seguido la estela de puzles pero dándole algo de profundidad a la historia, modos de juego y otras sugerencias que pedían los usuarios.

El lugar de pruebas futuristas, asépticas y diáfanas que vimos en Portal 1 se ha resquebrajado a un entorno no tan hermético e inquebrantable.
Esas fisuras hacen que podamos ver parte de la historia que se esconde detrás de esos experimentos y ese deterioro a su vez le dan mas variedad a los retos a los que te enfrentas.

En el primero tu enemigo ironizaba con tu situación y tus limitadas facultades humanas intentando mermarte en cada fase. En Portal 2 tu enemigo sigue con ese ataque sarcástico pero tu personaje no estará y cuenta con un "amigo" que aparecerá para ayudarte y sacarte algunas risas con sus comentarios.

En cuanto al juego y su jugabilidad es una mezcla de puzzles como el anterior. No te vas a encontrar momentos de acción directa estilo shooter ya que el personaje no cuenta con pistolas al uso por lo que tendrás que defenderte de los enemigos robóticos con ingenio.

Por último algo que se echaba de menos en el primero era un cooperativo y en este lo cumple notablemente con unas cuantas pruebas aparte (no en modo historia) para pasarlas con tu amigo.

La única parte negativa del juego podría ser que como el primero se hace demasiado corto pero también porque es muy adictivo que te hace querer pasarte todas las fases una tras otra.

La conclusión es que es una compra obligada si te consideras jugador pero esta segunda parte no se entendería que la jugaras sin tener antes la primera parte.

Nota: [b]9.4/10[/b]

Amazing! Better than the original and great characters along with moments that will get you every time.

-PORTAL 2 es de esos escasos títulos que superan por mucho a su antecesor original. Valve supo reinventar su obra que hace años llamo la atención por ser un soplo de aire fresco.
-Esta vez nos encontramos con una trama muchos mejorar elaborada, con distintos segmentos que nos irán revelando muchas incógnitas que nos dejo la primera parte, pero a su ves abriendo otras. Ya no se tratara exclusivamente de superar pruebas, tendremos momentos de mucha aventura y adrenalina donde habrá que reaccionar rápidamente.   
-La jugabilidad en general se mantiene intacta, añadiendo mucho mas elementos al entorno , para interactuar y asi avanzar en la trama. 
-En esta entrega ya queda mas que confirmado que los echos trascurren en el mismo universo de Half life, y eso mas, al principio del juego, se nos informa que el mundo sufrió una catástrofe, haciendo evidente la invasión del ejercito The Combine.
-Sin duda es muy recomendable, sobre todo si te gusto la primera parte. Portal 2 lleva al extremo el uso de los portales combinados con una excelente trama llena de misterios.

At the dawn of the new year, I decided to purchase this game and give it a go. I had previous experience with Portal as a child when I purchased the Orange Box on the Xbox 360, so my expectations here were definitely high. I was always intrigued at every moment in the game. From the truly daunting atmosphere to the mystery of the lore, Portal 2 never failed to hook me right back into its world. Sure, some of the puzzles were difficult at first, but that's what made progression throughout the game feel rewarding and well-paced. The length of the game is rather short, and I do see many people complain about this, but you can't deny that this game is a very well-made package of entertainment. The reason why I'm writing this review so late after I've played it is because the tropes and game itself still linger in my mind. Truly a masterpiece that has lots of love concentrated into it.

I don't think i have to leave a review. This game has allowed hours of fun with my friends, getting achievements, racing each other, and countless different cinematic maps and game modes from the workshop. The campaign is beautiful as well. The sound design and music came in always at just the right moment. There's so many secrets you can find hidden away behind some test chambers. Amazing game 10/10. Buy this game with the portal bundle, Portal 1 is just as good.

Although I had to watch a tutorial to finish many of the puzzles, Portal 2 is a great game to have in your library. There are separate single player and multiplayer campaigns, which add a lot of content to the game. The entire story was engaging and I didn't want to move away from this game. What is really cool is that there is workshop compatibility, which means that you can easily get mods and many other levels created by the players. There is tons of content in this game and you should buy it. 
(Its extremely cheap during sales, so pick it up then if you can't afford it right now)

Portal 2, Valve'ın aşırı yenilikçi oyunu Portal'ın devam oyunu. İlk oyunun mükemmel hikayesinin üstüne fazlasını bile ekleyen Portal 2 sizi hikaye açısından kesinlikle tatmin edecek. Oynanış konusunda ise yine aynı şekilde ilk oyunun üstüne koyuyor ve bize ilk oyundakinden daha uzun bir deneyim sunuyor. Seslendirme ve müzikler yine mükemmel, özellikle GLaDOS'un sesi her zamanki gibi harika. Oyunun bir de Co-op modu var, eğer birlikte oynayacak bir arkadaşınız varsa kesinlikle oynamalısınız. Co-op, normal oyundan biraz daha zor ama yine de aşırı zevkli. Bu arada Portal hikayesi, Portal 2'yle birlikte bitmiştir. Half-Life gibi 3. bir oyunu beklememize gerek yok, zira Half-Life'ın hikayesi yarım kalmışken Portal'ın hikayesi sona erdi. (Aç şu vanayı artık Gabe, 15 yıl oldu...)
